pageContent: Background: Interstitial brachytherapy for localised prostate cancer may be followed by transient increases in prostate-specific antigen (PSA) that resolve without therapy. Such PSA bounces may be associated with an improved outcome but often cause alarm in the patient and physician, and have defied explanation.

metaData.source:
Geographic disparities in prostate cancer outcomes--review of international patterns
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/25735366/
